website_summaries.verdict: A solid model by a trusted brand for an affordable price. The perfect scanner for experienced users who don't want to spend a lot.
pros: Reliable model that functions as a mobile or stationary police scanner
Features 300 channels and fast scanning of up to 100 channels at a time
cons: Compact in size but not as easy to take on the go as handheld models
Somewhat difficult to program, making it challenging for novice users

customer_reviews.title: Amazing scanner. Well worth the low price!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing scanner. I’m very familiar with radios and scanners and this scanner is top notch. The speaker volume is great but I am planning on purchasing an external speaker in hopes of a clearer sound. It came with a regular aluminum adjustable antenna along with a corded antenna that will mount to a window with suction cups for improved reception. I have no complaints on this item. If you are in the market for a simple, easy to use scanner, this one is the one I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic scanner. I had one similar many years ago ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic scanner. I had one similar many years ago and just missed having it around. This model has much more channel capacity with 100 different frequencies capable of being stored in the private settings for my county. I've read about how people have some trouble programming it, and there is a small learning curve. But once you understand how to do it, it's no big deal. Very compact and reliable scanner. During the recent massive snow storm, I learned a new appreciation for our first responders and the work they actually do on a daily basis. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Archos Victim

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner for desktop or mobile
customer_reviews.text: Good scanner for desktop or mobile. I bought this for mobile use. It fits perfectly in my center console which is very small. I always prefer Uniden Scanners. This is a great cheap scanner for a beginner to use. Easy to understand and operate.
customer_reviews.author: Joey W.

customer_reviews.title: Best, easied scanner to work..
customer_reviews.text: Had an old one from '' '' ?? Always had to reset channels . This one I set local channels , turn it on and BAM! I can scan my local channels that I programmed in. Kinda sad though , listening to my local PD , FD , like listening to the 3 stooges.. lol
customer_reviews.author: Clyde51

customer_reviews.title: Buy a new adjustable sound speaker if you are mounting in your truck or car, it's not that loud.
customer_reviews.text: My mom got this for my birthday because I am a volunteer firefighter and I wanted something in my truck and in my home in case the radio I got from my FD is dead or something. Surprisingly, I was thinking that this would be a letdown because most of our emergency equipment like sirens and lights are hard to find, I found out that I heard my fire department on the first turn on!! I love this thing. But be warned the sound quality is good, don't get me wrong, but I needed a speaker in order to hear it louder in my truck. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read the Manual Carefully
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the hang of it, the programming is simple. I only use it for local air traffic as I live in the flight path of an international airport. It's small and compact but the buttons are small and not easy to use. The display is impossible to read unless you are at eye level which is inconvenient. As an electronics item, it functions very well. Good pickup and sound. Works for what I wanted despite a couple of minor annoyances.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This thing is total garbage. My fault for not looking closer before hitting the buy button. It doesn't have a keypad and is impossible to program what you want. Comes pre-programmed with so many channels it takes forever to go through a cycle. Really bad. Just beware.
customer_reviews.author: Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for first time scanner use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use,would buy again good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: best scanner i have owned
customer_reviews.text: best scanner i have owned...Fast delivery packaged very well.setting up is easy read your manual take your time things will come to you as you read if you ever owned one before but if you didn't read your manual....Easy to understand..
customer_reviews.author: BuiltinWestchester

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: Most 800mhz bands are encrypted. This will not scan the majority of the Public Service Bands that use 800.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: A bit tricky
customer_reviews.text: OMG!!!! If you have zero patience please don’t get this!!! Purchased this for my dad, he received it and then mailed it down to me to program.. It took me quiet a while to figure out how to get this thing programmed. When programming you can only round robin and not type the frequency in.. Its a great unit just not user friendly
customer_reviews.author: Dan S

customer_reviews.title: Don't spend your working money.. complete junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in 2014, it's now Sept 2018.. I heard 2 guys talking on CB's in 2015 for about 3 minutes.. smh.. That's it that's all I've got from my $70+ dollars i spent on it.. lol.. complete junk..
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Adequate at best
customer_reviews.text: This receiver was purchased to replace a mid-80's BearCat 20/20 scanner that had provided outstanding service for nearly 35 years. Unfortunately, the BC355N does not measure up to the high standard set by its much older sibling. The audio is weak and the optional BC23A amplified speaker is required if you want to hear an intelligible broadcast from across the hangar (40 feet). On the plus side, reception with an external VHF antenna is very good.
customer_reviews.author: RBD

customer_reviews.title: this is a good radio, not very easy to program as were ...
customer_reviews.text: their is still activity on analog,this is a good radio,not very easy to program as were the bearcats of the 90's and even early 00's.it already contains the frequencies,so you dont need to have the numbers to punch in,as there is no number pad anyway.i receive a lot of birdies and dead carriers,still havent figured why.can listen to c.b.,taxicabs,some security,ham operators,both antennas receive the same signals and transmissions,one is not better than the other.i was hoping to hear csx-railroad but got nothing on those channels.overall for 86.99 not bad,but dont expect it to be alive with broadcasts.perhaps more than just the police have gone digital.
customer_reviews.author: mike macbeth

customer_reviews.title: Wide coverage scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift from my wife. I find the scanner a little hard to program and the sound quality is not a good as I would like. Of course it isn't a $500 scanner so I really didn't expect it to be a Cadillac but more of a Chevy. It offers a wide variety of frequencies to monitor so someone looking for a scanner that will do the job and not break the bank this is a good one!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L. Corrall

customer_reviews.title: If you a good 800MHz analog get this one
customer_reviews.text: Good analog scanner. It is not digital trunking and therefore does not carry the price. I have had some radio experience and programming , etc. on this unit was not difficult for me. If you are new at it and follow the manual slowly and carefully you should have no problem. I especially like the private bank to store my favorite frequencies in for quick access. Also the 800 MHz band has some good talk- around's (analog pick up's on trunk lines). This little rig will also hook up for mobile use in a vehicle. For the price this is a good analog scanner.
customer_reviews.author: kime

customer_reviews.title: Save your money...Just use a scanner app on your phone.
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. I spent several hours trying to get some kind of radio transmissions with no success. My neighbor is a police officer who informed me that most police departments have upgraded their radio systems to being encrypted. It may work in some areas, but in Florida where I live, I could not get any radio traffic. I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: j_m1964

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: After reading so many positive reviews I was so excited to recieve my scanner! However, I was severely disappointed. It's easy enough to set up but simply does not work. After watching countless videos and days of fooling with it, I'm coming to the conclusion I will have to return it. This thing will search and SEARCH all of the 800 frequencies but will NEVER pick anything up. I have adjusted the squelch, volumes, antenna, and still NOTHING. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Mclaughlin

customer_reviews.title: programmming..  took me a while to figure out Here is my solution
customer_reviews.text: My problem was (page 57) lock out feature.. Mine wouldn;t program until I held down lock down button (when trying to final program) a few seconds. Simple as that I have anothher scanner, took me 1/2 day putting freq into Private.. 100. Amazing scanner after you quit cussing it.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little Scanner
customer_reviews.text: The BC355N is perfect for those who desire a simple easy to setup and operate radio. Ability to key pad frequencies into unit would make it a 5++. I have owned a significant number of radios over the years and must say this is a great unit for the $. I will also say that a scanner is only as good as the Antenna which is attached to it so before you give up on a radio add a better antenna first. Phil Tee Staten Island NY
customer_reviews.author: Phil Tee

customer_reviews.title: Analog in a digital world...
customer_reviews.text: I live in Houston, so radio traffic is very heavy, HOWEVER, police and most emergency channels are now digital and this is an analog reciever, meaning it won't pick up police and most government channels, so I'm relegated to listening to a few volunteer fire, ship channel, and air traffic. So if you want to pick up police and other emergency channels you'll either have to bite the bullet and buy a digital scanner or online scanner streams.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Uniden BC355N 800 MHz 300-Channel Base/Mobile Scanner.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy it. Takes a little time getting the codes but the more you listen and watch the codes the easier it gets. Haven't had a chance to use the Tram 1089-BNC Scanner Mini-Magnet Antenna VHF/UHF/800mhz-1,300mhz with BNC-Male Connector, but i will soon.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: One of the best scanners I’ve ever had!
customer_reviews.text: For beginners and most amateurs, this is an excellent radio! It is very easy to install... It comes with two car plugs (One for permanent insulation via the car’s fuse box. The second simply plugs into the car’s charging port) And a wall plug. It’s slightly complicated at first, but pretty easy to pick up. It also comes with 2 antennas (One for the car and one for home) Both work very well and I can even pick up radio from the next state over!
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Know what ya getting bad expierence
customer_reviews.text: Don’t get I’d live in mi or states that have digital cause ain’t work .. couldn’t get even one stationed called unisex they said won’t work in your state I said why sell them in our state now gotta send back she said this model number will work guese what they want 449 on amazon for it ya kidding.. waste of time and money..
customer_reviews.author: robert vanhevel

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty much useless
customer_reviews.text: After trying to program this scanner several times and actually having three more people who have scanners try to program it, it still doesn't work as expected. Not sure if the scanner is defective or if it's just that hard to program. It's pretty much useless.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Roupe

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It is really a great scanner. I love it. It is worth the money. Works great and it is easy to program of you pay attention to the way the instructions. It took me a day to figure out I was programming it wrong. But figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Mckeague

customer_reviews.title: Repeat order, now with two scanners set up: ...
customer_reviews.text: Repeat order, now with two scanners set up: 1 set to Police/ParaMedic/Fire and the other set to Aviation. Most interesting to listen to the events and happenings around where I live.
customer_reviews.author: Ray F. Longaker Jr.

customer_reviews.title: save your money dont buy it
customer_reviews.text: instructions are in Japanize and English is back wards. ive tried to get my money back but nothing yet
customer_reviews.author: mark crist

customer_reviews.title: Great deal but doesn't work like a usual scanner
customer_reviews.text: I think it is a great deal for an 800 frequency scanner but it doesn't work like one you just put the local frequencies in. Works great as a Mobil unit, make sure to buy an external antenna for that purpose. Scans frequencies numerical so you miss out if both the fire department and police are called.
customer_reviews.author: gary king

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great little scanner and was easy to mount under the CB radio
customer_reviews.author: James Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Bearcat BC355N scanner
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Bear cat scanners for over 20 years, all have Bern reliable and given good service. The features, such as sub audible tones, turbo scan, have all added to making these the best scanner for your money
customer_reviews.author: columbia 645

customer_reviews.title: I can't use it like I would like.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if my problem is unique to my area, but it starts to scan then it hits a certain channel and I get static like someone has keyed their mic no words but it stays on that channel and quits scanning. Of course you can make it go on but you have to do that every 10 seconds. the scanner is quality but it is like someone is jamming the airways.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasts, buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these now in the last year that the sound has almost completely gone out on. I had them hooked up to external speakers and something internal with the scanner went out and now the sound is almost non existent and very scratchy whether plugged into speaker or not.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Pay Attention To The Description
customer_reviews.text: Did not realize this would not pick up my local stations. It did pick up 2 counties over and some random guy that was doing a radio check over and over. I have since returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Receives great. I have had scanner and radios for over ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this with a permanently mounted vehicle antenna. Receives great. I have had scanner and radios for over 20 years. To a beginner, it will be very difficult to program. Once it's programmed, its user free, and loud. I can drive 55mph and still hear it with my window down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic scanner!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scanner! Easy setup, following the directions in the user manual. Clear, sharp reception. Let's me keep abreast of what is happening locally. Highly recommend this product for those who wish to monitor local events.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardaj

customer_reviews.title: Listens to everything, and is difficult to program
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for a fire station so we could listen to fireground/tactical channels as well as the local police departments, but there is no way to directly input the frequencies you want to scan. Instead, you listen to absolutely everything and have to sit on top of the radio to be able to program in or hold the frequency you want. It works well to listen, but not so great for those who want to listen to particular things.
customer_reviews.author: HAMMOND RANCH FIRE

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: This little guy works great. There are still several counties around me that haven’t went digital so I hear traffic stops and dispatch sending officers out on calls. I’m connected to an outdoor discone antenna the weather has been so bad here I’ve not put the antenna on a pole yet and I’m still picking up 30 miles away.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cannot return unworkable scanner
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is impossible to set up. I programmed the few channels I wanted to hear but it didn't give me anything, just loud interference. I have tried several times and it is not working. Now I've been told I cannot return it because of the COVID 19 virus. What should I do now?
customer_reviews.author: kenneth bartron

customer_reviews.title: My review on this product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good scanner easy to use easy to program if you follow instructions on YouTube
customer_reviews.author: Michael Robledo

customer_reviews.title: product arrived as stated.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had time to even set the thing up but here's your feedback you couldn't wait for
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Interesting to listen to.
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit difficult to set up. But once done, we listen to our local Fire department call. Amazing the work that our firefighters and EMS provide.
customer_reviews.author: maryz

customer_reviews.title: It was a good deal.
customer_reviews.text: I like the unit and added speaker. I did not like the Third Party Delivery (Fed Ex) Stated they left the package at the front door, but dropped it in wet grass (raining) approx. 1-2 feet from the busy road side. It could have been stolen, run over by a car or the postman of got wet enough to destroy the electrical unit.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is bad, reception is great
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good scanner but the speaker is pretty horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: This is number two in the world
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this scanner. It was so easy to set up. I had it up and running with 15 minutes of receiving it. Great sound quality even with the poor antenna I'm using on it. I found it easier then the BC365 to get up and running. Well done Uniden and well done Amazon for your quick service. This is the second radio I have purchased from you and I recommend you to other shoppers.
customer_reviews.author: Alf

customer_reviews.title: Great little analog scanner
customer_reviews.text: Covers most bands of interest. Could only be better if it covered the 1.25 meter ham band but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: V-Man

customer_reviews.title: Please make it clear to the customer that this is an ANALOG scanner, not DIGITAL
customer_reviews.text: Th scanner, itself, is fine for an ANALOG scanner. they should make it very clear that the scanner is analog, in the title. I ordered it and had to return because I wanted a digital scanner.
customer_reviews.author: BigJay

customer_reviews.title: Buttons stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner and set it up immediately, not that difficult to program, I’ve had scanners before. The problem is, I tried to reprogram the unit and found that none of the buttons work. I’ve read about a hard reboot ,but I don’t want to have to buy another scanner if this one doesn’t reboot correctly. Not sure I would give it a high recommendation, although it is still working.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Zabawa

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my ninety-year-old father and it just does not pick anything up. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: not made for the times nothing but a paper wate can not peogram to the new channeis out there junk sent back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great scanner to buy
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this radio scanner, the sound quality of the speaker is very bad and this scanner dors not pick necessarily channels to hear, would not recommend to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: perucho99

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: awesome radio little hard to understand at first but found to be easy to program afterwards
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Sanders

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth it
customer_reviews.text: For the price You pay it’s worth it because you can have it set up in your house or you can have it on the go in your vehicle I give it two thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: Scott C

customer_reviews.title: No problems
customer_reviews.text: I listen to mine all the time. I had someone more electronic savvy to program it. But i have had no problems at all with it. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Durable unit!
customer_reviews.text: Overall great unit for the price. Some difficulties with programming. Sound good for quiet areas / office. External speaker needed for bays or in vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Steve O

customer_reviews.title: 911 what's your emergency@
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy this scanner, Was a little tricky at first but once I figured it out,,was pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: P Lutsky

customer_reviews.title: Fire scanner not for listing to where cops are
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give it a zero star but then that would give the seller a bad name and it was not the sellers fault... my hubby thought it would work but we needed a diffent kind.. this would work great for fire scanner just not a cop scanner
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Digital or analog
customer_reviews.text: Product was good. But I didn't realize that I couldn't get my local police channels because they went to digital and this is analog. Disappointed.make sure you know if your local stations are digital or analog because this won't work
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Niemi

customer_reviews.title: Cheap scanner
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to program and the sound quality is horrible
customer_reviews.author: Julianne doherty

customer_reviews.title: Received a used scanner
customer_reviews.text: I was sad to see that this scanner was used. I came with the wires in a zip-lock bags, all jumbeled up, with model airplane parts inside as well. There was no manual and it wasn't in the original box, just a bag...
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A.

customer_reviews.title: Really good scanner!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this scanner so I could listen primarily for my fire departments radio frequency. This works really well!! It took my a little bit to figure out how to actually program it but now that I got it running I absolutely love this!! Great for your house! I’m planning on trying this in my car eventually too!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Majowicz

customer_reviews.title: Not so good.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this as a Christmas present for me from my husband. It is difficult to set up. We have only heard one scan since we got it and that was a dispatcher.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Police scanner
customer_reviews.text: Compact, easy to program, scanner has static but probably due to location more than anything. Great little weather radio button so do not need to scan for weather
customer_reviews.author: Abbytha

customer_reviews.title: Clarity of speaker is not all that great and needs an external 8 ohm speaker to go ...
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to program according to instruction pamphlet that came with it. Clarity of speaker is not all that great and needs an external 8 ohm speaker to go with it. Computer speakers cause distortion and hum in back ground.
customer_reviews.author: Warren L. Cotts

customer_reviews.title: Not for the experienced short wave person.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is the easiest I have ever set up. Just push the buttons for what u want to listen to. This would be great for first timers. Works the best with the window antenna. Would definitely buy this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: For the money you will not do better. It can be used by a novice or a pro.
customer_reviews.author: FloodMan

customer_reviews.title: More pro than con
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty complicated, even for my third base radio. I still can't get it to scan a few private channels. It's frustrating, but easy to manually switch between them. Small and compact, it fits just about anywhere. The good outweigh the bad.
customer_reviews.author: Evan W.

customer_reviews.title: Reception Range
customer_reviews.text: Unless you live right next to an airport I suggest you also get an external antenna for your house roof.
customer_reviews.author: Sean N Henville

customer_reviews.title: ... times to prevent static but other then that I love it and it comes in very handy
customer_reviews.text: Can't seem to raise the squelch enough at times to prevent static but other then that I love it and it comes in very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J Bartha

customer_reviews.title: had to see
customer_reviews.text: Receiver screen is very small and is hard to read, but the eception is GOOD. I WOULD NOTN RECCOMEND THIS ITEM FOR PEO;E with bad eyesight,
customer_reviews.author: kidbunch

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for my husband. I arrived in good condition and is easy to use. It serves our purpose well and was priced fairly.
customer_reviews.author: lynn mackenzie mutschler

customer_reviews.title: Found it to be a very nice mobile unit for "quick scanning" of NOAA frequencies
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit for a recent long road trip, as I haven't yet installed my other scanner in my new car. Found it to be a very nice mobile unit for "quick scanning" of NOAA frequencies, and CB channel 19 - the WX and CB buttons are a great feature. Found the ability to scan frequency ranges instead of "service" banks to also be very useful. Reception with the supplied "suction cup" antenna is reasonable, but an inexpensive magnetic antenna (like from Hustler) makes a real improvement. Audio is very good, even without an external speaker. Overall, I'd rank this unit as an 11 (think Spinal Tap).
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Timmins

customer_reviews.title: Police/fire scanner
customer_reviews.text: The scanner had a tinny sound so an external speaker will be needed if used in a house.
customer_reviews.author: Judie Welch

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it it is an expensive paperweight
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money on this it is carp and I have been to the web site! Never heard anyone
customer_reviews.author: Cindy639

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about the "easy to set up" reviews by looking at the controls but after reading the instructions it was very simple. I had it set up to my local channels within 30 minutes of getting it out of the box. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonianWoman

customer_reviews.title: Scamming people.
customer_reviews.text: I disliked the fact that I couldn't get any channels and had to refund it, only to find out that there is a restocking fee for something that never worked. Just start a company that takes people's money, cus that's what your doing!
customer_reviews.author: Erica P

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great reception off supplied telescoping antenna across county. Gave as gift, happy recipient.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: Great for traveling. Quick set-up. I built a battery pack using A batteries, for lost-power monitoring.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hodge

customer_reviews.title: I really like it
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying it it is really plain and I want in one
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have owned scanner(s) forever. My first scanner took crystals, my previous lasted 20 years ( Bearcat ). This new scanner is heads above what I assumed a low cost scanner could provide. It's clear and has great volume, and I would recommend it to anyone seeking above average performance.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: Very compact scanner! While you pick up plenty of activity on the included antenna, I’d suggest a larger antenna to detect even more signals. I like the diverse range of freq bands this offers—much more than you normally get from other scanners in its price range.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: easy program nice price wish this was didgital as many countys on digital but is nice scanner for price
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: works great, have not yet instald it yet in my ...
customer_reviews.text: works great, have not yet instald it yet in my car wait to do so when I get my other car . but i'm sure it will work great . nice unit no problems with any thing about it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't  buy this scanner
customer_reviews.text: The BC 355N has very poor sensitivity, Unless you are looking directly at the display you cannot see what frequency is displayed. You absolute;y must use an external speaker otherwise the audio is not understandable. Programming is a challenge. I guess I never learn "You get what you pay for"
customer_reviews.author: mgdriver

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: The product works well but the operating instructions suck! If you want to "Program" a specific channel you have to "grab it" as it is being used???? No way to enter frequencies into a private channel, This is probably the lousiest instruction manual I have ever tried to use. It may be a very good device but you better be a scanner savant to figure out how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews saying it can be difficult or confusing to program but it isn't. I'm new to scanning and I watched a simple video online and I was listening to all kinds of cool frequencies within minutes. Very fun scanner. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: I guess if you want a radio that is ready to use this one fits the bill. I didn't like that I can't put in local channels you can't program any in it at all
customer_reviews.author: pas-indi

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality very poor
customer_reviews.text: unit comes with no instructions. I had to go on YouTube to figure out how to program the scanner. Found it was not that easy. Also the tiny speaker has a very poor sound quality. I have to return as it is to difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: gregcre

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied overall
customer_reviews.text: The sound is so clear there is no need for an external speaker. I just wish there was an easier way to save the frequencies trying to program other than the buttons provided. Maybe if it was able to connect to a pc program.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Magaña

customer_reviews.title: Great value nice product
customer_reviews.text: The product is exactly what I wanted for my truck that’s why I ordered two of them. One was for my son’s birthday he volunteers with the local fire department. He loves it so I got myself one. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Bellavita

customer_reviews.title: This is a great scanner for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scanner for the price. The only problem I had was programming it. I watched a video on you tube and had it programmed in about an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Leatherman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Still hoping I can get to it to pick up something other than static, purchased the antenna recommend for it and still, nothing.
customer_reviews.author: apcapps

customer_reviews.title: I’ll learn
customer_reviews.text: Might be easy for some people to use not me
customer_reviews.author: Linda Sasser

customer_reviews.title: Unit works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this newer model to replace an older one. Works great. Love the improvements. I added a flexible antenna so I could slide the unit under the passenger seat and out of the way. Easy to program.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: We could not get it figured out so haven't been able to use.way to complicated for the average person
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item to replace the uniden scanner i've had for 25 years this item is nothing like picture shows very small unit and doesn't even compare to my old one hardly picks up anything very disappointed with this item would never recommend this to anyone......
customer_reviews.author: Regina F.

customer_reviews.title: BUT IF YOU FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS IT NOT TO BAD. NOT FOR BEGINNERS
customer_reviews.text: IT TAKES A LITTLE BIT TO PROGRAM,BUT IF YOU FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS IT NOT TO BAD. NOT FOR BEGINNERS. SPEAKER COULD BE LOUDER. IM USING EXTERNAL SPEAKER.
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Great radio. In years past it would have cost ...
customer_reviews.text: Great radio. In years past it would have cost over $300.00 for a 800 mz radio. This radio gives all frequencies including airplanes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth or fifth scanner that I have had. It's almost impossible to use, because there is no way to enter frequencies directly. Instead, you have to scan or step through closely spaced frequencies and select the ones you want to save.
customer_reviews.author: Henry H. Perritt

customer_reviews.title: Great value for dollar !
customer_reviews.text: Powerful unit. Picks up tons of signals. Easy to use. Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Christie

product_meta.title: Uniden BC355N 800 MHz 300-Channel Base/Mobile Scanner, Close Call RF Capture, Pre-programmed Search “Action” Bands to Hear Police, Ambulance, Fire, Amateur Radio, Public Utilities, Weather, and More, Black
product_meta.description: "The BC355N is an affordable, basic mobile scanner that's great for home or mobile use, with 300 storable channels, coverage of all the ""action"" bands, convenient features like ""close call"" and program lock, and a wealth of powering options for different applications. Receives conventional channels on the following frequencies: (25-54 MHz) (108-174 MHz) (225-380 MHz) (406-512 MHz) (806-956 MHz) (excluding cellular telephone bands) "
feature_bullets: The Uniden Bearcat BC355N Mobile/Base Scanner is one of the most feature packed, user-friendly, entry level scanners available today. It can pick up analog receptions including 6 Service banks for monitoring Police, Fire, Emergency Medical Services, Marine, Air, Weather, and CB frequencies.

The BC355N features “Close Call RF Capture Technology,” which instantly tunes to signals from nearby transmitters. This pre-programmed search makes it easier to find active frequencies and helps you stay on top of local happenings and emergencies in your area. 100 ch/sec Scan Speed (max)

You can save up to 300 frequencies that are scanned along with the preset frequencies. So whenever you encounter a newly activated local frequency for any service category, you can add it to the bank for that category. This gives you quick access to the frequencies you want to hear.

The BC355N comes complete with a backlit display, making it easier to read in low light conditions, along with AC adapter, a DC power cable and an automotive power outlet plug, giving you more options for supplying power at home or in your car. Frequency range for aircraft band is AM mode 8.33 STEP (kHz) at 108.0000, 136.9916(Lower and Upper)

If you’re looking for an affordable way to jump into the world of scanners, the BC355N may be the right choice for you. (Please note: model BC355N is not suitable for trunking or digital radio system monitoring. If you live in an area where trunking or digital radio systems are used, you need to upgrade to a Uniden Digital model (“D” stands for Digital), such as models BCD996P2, BCD436HP, BCD536HP, BCD325P2, or HomePatrol-2.
